located at the foot of the northern side of the Balkan mountains. Rositsa river crossing it, and Alexander Stamboliyski dam (a few kilometers away from the town) make up Sevlievo's waterscape.
, sadly, is not an option since there is no railway.

is the most popular way to get to Sevlievo. There are buses departing from Sofia all over the day from 8.00 AM to 18.00 PM. Usually the itinerary takes up to two hours and a half. Average ticket cost (depending on the company): 7 euros.

Sofia's central bus station schedule

from Sofia is often easy if you depart before noon. You need to take tram N.22 from Poduyane rail station and take off at the next stop. From that stop you change to bus N.90 and take off after coming out of the subway. Then you hit the highway.
In summer, Rositsa River is an attractive spot for strolling, fishing or getting a natural peeling provided by little fishes eating the dead skin of your feet.

Club "Coffee Theatre". A, literally, underground pub where you can eat, drink and smoke while listening to pop and rock from the 80's and 90's. Spacious enough to shelter 150 people. Addsress : 10, Al. Batemberg str. The keeper's name is Bobby and you can reach him on +359894654111 / +359886666585
